awd_titl_txt: Computer Laboratory in Human Experimental Psychology
awd_abstract_narration: The psychology department curricula are advanced by the                    establishment of a computer laboratory in human experimental                    psychology. A network of personal computers is used in teaching the             research process and in the application of the research process in              laboratory courses. The beneficiaries of the proposal are: (a)                  traditional psychology majors, who are required to participate in a             three or four semester sequence of research courses, and (b) Human              Factors and Psychobiology majors, who have special requirements in              research. The proposal has direct impact on these students through the          following courses: Research Methods, Experimental Psychology, Human             Learning and Memory,Sensation  and Perception, Physiological                    Psychology, Experimental Life-span Psychology, and Human Cognition. The         award will be matched by an equal amount from the grantee.
